collections

Class ShapeCollection

  • java.lang.Object
    • collections.ShapeCollection

  • public class ShapeCollection
extends java.lang.Object
    A class that stores a collection of all different kinds of Shapes in a single array.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private Shape[] allShapes
      Array that stores the Shapes in the collection.
      private int currentNumberOfShapes
      Count of how many shapes are currently in the array.
      private static int MAXIMUM_SHAPES
      Maximum number of shapes that can be stored in the collection.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ShapeCollection()
      Constructor of ShapeCollection.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean addNewCircle(double radius)
      Given the radius of a Circle, attempts to create a new Circle and places it in the allShapes array.
      boolean addNewRectangle(double[] dimensionsIn)
      Given the dimensions of a Rectangle, attempts to create a new Rectangle and places it in the allShapes array.
      boolean addNewTriangle(double[] dimensionsIn)
      Given the dimensions of a Triangle, attempts to create a new Triangle and places it in the allShapes array.
      boolean addShape(Shape shape)
      Given a Shape, attempts to place it in the allShapes array.
      private boolean atMaxLimit()
      Used to quickly determine if the array is at maximum capacity.

      Creates and returns a new array of size MAXIMUM_SHAPES containing all Shapes in the collection.

      Creates and returns a new array of size MAXIMUM_SHAPES containing all Circles in the collection.

      Creates and returns a new array of size MAXIMUM_SHAPES containing all Rectangles in the collection.

      Sums and returns the area of all Shapes.

    • Field Detail

      • MAXIMUM_SHAPES

        private static final int MAXIMUM_SHAPES
        Maximum number of shapes that can be stored in the collection. Determines size of the array. Has the value of 6.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • allShapes

        private Shape[] allShapes
        Array that stores the Shapes in the collection.

      • currentNumberOfShapes

        private int currentNumberOfShapes
        Count of how many shapes are currently in the array. Increased whenever a new shape is add. Used to determine where new shapes should be placed in the array. Also used when traversing the array as the stopping point so unused elements are not processed.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ShapeCollection

        public ShapeCollection()
        Constructor of ShapeCollection. Creates array of Shapes of size MAXIMUM_SHAPES. Initializes currentNumberOfShapes to zero.

    • Method Detail

      • addNewRectangle

        public boolean addNewRectangle(double[] dimensionsIn)
        Given the dimensions of a Rectangle, attempts to create a new Rectangle and places it in the allShapes array. If possible, the new Rectangle is placed in the first unused index. If there is not space for the new Rectangle no changes are made.
        Parameters:
        dimensionsIn - Dimensions of the Rectangle to be added.
        Returns:
        True if the new Rectangle is added, false if not.

      • addNewTriangle

        public boolean addNewTriangle(double[] dimensionsIn)
        Given the dimensions of a Triangle, attempts to create a new Triangle and places it in the allShapes array. If possible, the new Triangle is placed in the first unused index. If there is not space for the new Triangle no changes are made.
        Parameters:
        dimensionsIn - Dimensions of the Triangle to be added.
        Returns:
        True if the new Triangle is added, false if not.

      • addNewCircle

        public boolean addNewCircle(double radius)
        Given the radius of a Circle, attempts to create a new Circle and places it in the allShapes array. If possible, the new Circle is placed in the first unused index. If there is not space for the new Circle no changes are made.
        Parameters:
        radius - Radius of the Circle to be added.
        Returns:
        True if the new Circle is added, false if not.

      • addShape

        public boolean addShape(Shape shape)
        Given a Shape, attempts to place it in the allShapes array. If possible, the Shape is placed in the first unused index as determined by currentNumberOfShapes. If there is not space for the Shape or the reference passed is null no changes are made.
        Parameters:
        shape - Shape to be added.
        Returns:
        True if the Shape is added, false if not.

      • getAllShapes

        public Shape[] getAllShapes()
        Creates and returns a new array of size MAXIMUM_SHAPES containing all Shapes in the collection. Shapes appear in the same order they are in the local array. Unused elements will have the value of null.
        Returns:
        Array of all shapes in the collection.

      • getRectangles

        public Rectangle[] getRectangles()
        Creates and returns a new array of size MAXIMUM_SHAPES containing all Rectangles in the collection. Rectangles appear in the same order they are in the local array. The returned array will be compact, meaning there are no unused elements between objects. Unused elements will have the value of null.
        Returns:
        Array of Rectangles in the collection.

      • getTriangles

        public Triangle[] getTriangles()
        Creates and returns a new array of size MAXIMUM_SHAPES containing all Triangles in the collection. Triangles appear in the same order they are in the local array. The returned array will be compact, meaning there are no unused elements between objects. Unused elements will have the value of null.
        Returns:
        Array of Triangles in the collection.

      • getCircles

        public Circle[] getCircles()
        Creates and returns a new array of size MAXIMUM_SHAPES containing all Circles in the collection. Circles appear in the same order they are in the local array. The returned array will be compact, meaning there are no unused elements between objects. Unused elements will have the value of null.
        Returns:
        Array of Circles in the collection.

      • totalAreaOfShapes

        public double totalAreaOfShapes()
        Sums and returns the area of all Shapes.
        Returns:
        Area of all Shapes.

      • atMaxLimit

        private boolean atMaxLimit()
        Used to quickly determine if the array is at maximum capacity.
        Returns:
        True if at maximum limit, false if it is not.
